decision_conditions: The Pine and the Douglas Fir are situated within the front garden of 33 The Greenway. These trees present mature and attractive crowns which can be viewed from multiple corners within the Greenway. The pair of trees has a high amenity value, therefore making a significant positive contribution to the appearance of the local landscape.

The Pine and the Douglas Fir are both in good condition. The work proposed is considered excessive and would considerably lessen the height and spread of the appeal trees and consistently reduce their contribution to the character and appearance of the area.Moreover, no evidence has been provided concerning the need to carry out such work, being shading and dropping of needles not classed as arboricultural reasons. The proposed work would make the trees appear excessively cut back, significantly damaging their amenity value and increasing the risk of dieback.
The proposed work to reduce the crowns will result in a considerable harm to the character and
The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.
Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981:  Note that it is an offence under this act to disturb roosting bats, nesting birds or any other protected species.

Statutory crown lifting of trees: This does not require formal consent of the Council if the clearance only involves the removal of branches to give a separation between the footway and the tips of the lowest branches by up to 2.3m or the carriageway by up to 5.2m.
description: To reduce height by 4m, crown thin by 30% and crown lift to 3m One Scots Pine, T28, To reduce to finished height of Pine and lightly reshape One Douglas Fir (Spruce on application) T27 on TPO 514
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
